business.headline: Bajaj Housing Finance IPO listing: Will it live up to hype with big returns?Brokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.

False, malicious: Madhabi Puri Buch, husband reject conflict of interest claimsIn a joint statement, Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and husband Dhaval Buch rejected recent allegations of conflict of interest as "false, malicious, and defamatory."

Bajaj Finance, Bajaj Finserv shares gain amid housing unit IPO buzzThe buzz around the Bajaj Housing Finance IPO, which is set to make its stock market debut on September 16, has led traders on Dalal Street to snap up shares of other publicly traded Bajaj companies, hoping to capitalise on the momentum.

Western Carriers IPO opens for bidding: Should you subscribe or skip? Western Carriers (India) Limited has allocated 85,96,743 equity shares to 15 anchor investors, raising Rs 148 crore before its proposed IPO.
SpiceJet shares surge 9%: What's fuelling the rally and will it continue?SpiceJet share price: Despite regulatory challenges, the airline's shares have surged recently. Will the rally hold?

PN Gadgil Jewellers IPO allotment: Step-by-step guide to check statusPN Gadgil Jewellers IPO allotment: If you've applied for the IPO, you can check the allotment status online in a few simple steps through the websites of the BSE and Bigshare Services.

Bajaj Housing Finance IPO: Got allotment? Check expected listing gainsBrokerages tracking the IPO have already indicated that the IPO is set for a positive listing, with the grey market premium (GMP) indicating that investors will see their money double on listing day.
Adani Group shares drop after Hindenburg's fresh allegationsHindenburg Research claimed that Swiss authorities had frozen over $310 million across several Swiss bank accounts.
Sensex, Nifty pause rally near record highs; Bajaj twins gainThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 134.05 points to 82,828.66 at 10:28 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 44.30 points to 25,344.60.

Adani Group rejects Hindenburg claim of Swiss banks' $310 million funds freezeHindenburg cited a Swiss media outlet, Gotham City, which alleged that more than $310 million belonging to an alleged frontman for billionaire Gautam Adani is sequestered in six Swiss banks. The Adani Group "unequivocally" rejected the claim.

Amazon, Flipkart found violating Indian competition laws: ReportA probe by the Competition Commission of India (CCI) found that e-commerce giants Amazon and Flipkart engaged in anti-competitive practices by favouring select sellers on their platforms.

Understanding circle rates: A simple guide for homebuyers and sellersUnderstanding the concept of circle rates, and how they influence property valuations, has become critical for anyone navigating the real estate market.
Retail inflation rises to 3.65% in August, second lowest in last five yearsRetail inflation rises to 3.65 per cent in August compared to 3.6 per cent in July, as per government data.

India's semiconductor boom: These stocks could be your best pickThe development of the semiconductor value chain—ranging from chip design to manufacturing and assembly, is expected to benefit various companies in the sector.

Sensex gains 1,500 points on US rate cut optimism; Granules India tanks 17%The S&P BSE Sensex was up 1,439.55 points to 82,962.71 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 gained nearly 470.45 points to settle at 25,388.90.

Explained: Why Granules India shares crashed nearly 17% todayGranules India stock price: With this drop, the stock now trades roughly 22% below its all-time high of Rs 724.55, reached earlier in the month

PwC to cut 1,800 jobs in first major layoff since 2009The layoff affects approximately 2.5% of the company's US workforce and impacts a range of positions, including associates, managing directors, and employees in business services, audit, and tax departments.
Sensex surges 1,000 points, Nifty rises; investors add Rs 5 lakh croreThe S&P BSE Sensex added1048.49 points to 82,571.65, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 343.65 points to 25,262.10.
Petrol, diesel prices may fall if crude oil rates remain low: ReportCrude oil prices have recently dropped to their lowest point in nearly three years, bringing some hope for lower fuel prices.

Ayushman Bharat: Senior citizens aged 70 and above to get these benefitsAyushman Bharat: The expansion aims to ease the financial burden of healthcare for the elderly, who often face high medical expenses.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.

However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.

While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.

Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. 

On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.

Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: False, malicious: Madhabi Puri Buch, husband reject conflict of interest claimsIn a joint statement, Sebi chief Madhabi Puri Buch and husband Dhaval Buch rejected recent allegations of conflict of interest as "false, malicious, and defamatory."

Video of restaurant owner's apology to Finance Minister leaked, Annamalai regretsA row erupted after BJP's Tamil Nadu unit posted a video of Sri Annapoorna restaurant owner Srinivasan apologising to Nirmala Sitharaman during a private conversation.

Arvind Kejriwal gets bail, but Supreme Court split on legality of CBI's arrestArvind Kejriwal Bail Order: The two Supreme Court judges delivered separate but concurring judgments. While Justice Surya Kant held Arvind Kejriwal's arrest valid, Justice Bhuyan called it 'unjustified'.

Man shot 8 times outside gym in posh Delhi locality, murder on CCTVIn the CCTV footage, accessed by India Today, Nadir Shah is seen talking to another man while standing next to a black SUV before being shot multiple times.

How I was assaulted by Rahul Gandhi's team in Dallas, TexasSince his last trip to the US, Rahul Gandhi has ascended to the role of Leader of the Opposition, following an unexpectedly strong performance in the recent general elections.

The Buckingham Murders Review: Kareena Kapoor is in top formReleased-Fri Sep 13, 2024The Buckingham Murders released in theatres today, September 13. Is this murder mystery by Hansal Mehta, featuring Kareena Kapoor in the lead, worth a watch? Read the review to know.

CBI must show it's uncaged parrot: Supreme Court judge on Arvind Kejriwal arrestArvind Kejriwal was first arrested by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) on March 21 in a money laundering case connected to the liquor policy scam. The CBI arrested him later on June 26 in a corruption case.

Rafael Nadal pulls out of Laver Cup: Will tennis great return to action in 2024?Rafael Nadal withdrew from Laver Cup 2024, adding fuel to speculation about his retirement from professional tennis. The 22-time Grand Slam champion has seemingly adopted a wait-and-watch approach in a season where he has struggled to get back to his best.

Caged parrot since Coalgate days, why BJP, Congress didn't set CBI freeThe imagery of a caged parrot is centuries old and has to do with Vasco da Gama's travels to India. The "caged parrot" metaphor has been used by the Supreme Court for the CBI not just in the Arvind Kejriwal liquorgate case but earlier in 2013 in the coal scam case, when the Congress was in power.

Declare Bengal's independence from Modi rule, Bangladesh Islamist tells MamataIn a video, Islamist Jashimuddin Rahmani Hafi, the chief of al-Qaida affiliate, Ansarullah Bangla Team (ABT), asked West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee to "declare independence from Modi's rule". The recently freed terrorist also said that "India will be partitioned, and Islamist flags hoisted over Delhi".

Sector 36 Review: A tough watch where Vikrant Massey and Deepak Dobriyal excelReleased-Fri Sep 13, 2024The Netflix film Sector 36 is based on the 2006 Nithari serial killings in Noida. The film is produced by Maddock and features Vikrant Massey and Deepak Dobriyal delivering strong performances.

Arvind Kejriwal bail conditions: Can't enter Chief Minister's office, sign filesThe Supreme Court set certain conditions while granting bail to Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal in the liquor policy case. He has been in jail since April 1.

Loyal dog chases ambulance carrying owner. Video ends on a heartwarming note In a viral video, a loyal dog was seen chasing an ambulance carrying its ailing owner to the hospital. What happened next is absolutely heartwarming.

Mysterious signal heard across the planet kept humming for nine daysInstead of the usual earthquake rumble, the signal was a continuous hum with only one vibration frequency, and it lasted for nine days.

Nurse cuts doctor's private parts, escapes gangrape bid at Bihar hospitalA nurse at a private hospital in Bihar's Samastipur district inflicted a cut on a doctor's private parts with a surgical blade when he, along with his two associates, allegedly tried to rape her inside the hospital.

Incel nonsense: Elon Musk's daughter blasts him for offering Taylor Swift a childTesla CEO Elon Musk authored a post on X on September 11 offering to give her a child. The post, in response to Taylor Swift's endorsement of US Vice President, garnered criticism on the internet, including from his 20-year-old transgender daughter.

Hina Khan thanks Mahima Chaudhary for support during chemo, calls her 'divine soul' Actor Hina Khan wrote a beautiful birthday note for Mahima Chaudhary. The actor thanked Mahima for her support and encouragement during her cancer journey.

After Shimla, clashes between cops, locals in Mandi over illegal mosquePolice in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi used water cannons to disperse protesters demanding the demolition of an alleged illegal mosque.

Apple India website is down just hours ahead of iPhone 16 pre-ordersJust hours before the pre-orders for the iPhone 16 series, the Apple India website went offline, leaving customers eagerly awaiting their chance to purchase the latest devices in a temporary hold.

Sunita Williams undergoes eye checks ahead of calling home tonightWilliams and Wilmore, who launched aboard Boeing's Starliner spacecraft on June 5, 2024, have been part of an unexpected turn of events.

Where did that come from? Car flies out of nowhere, crashes on Alwar roadThe road has been closed for two years due to waterlogging. The car hit a dirt mound and flew over a passing bus before crashing.

Kudos for staying strong: Arvind Kejriwal's wife Sunita after bail orderDelhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's wife Sunita Kejriwal congratulated Aam Aadmi Party after the party supremo was granted bail by the Supreme Court in the Delhi liquor policy case.

Apple AirPods Pro 2 is now officially the first over-the-counter hearing aid device Apple AirPods Pro 2 have received FDA approval to function as over-the-counter hearing aids through a software update. This feature aims to assist users with mild-to-moderate hearing loss by enhancing sounds in real time.

Heavy rain lashes Delhi-NCR, several roads waterlogged, more showers in storeThe weather department has issued an orange alert for Delhi-NCR, indicating a "be prepared" mode. The alert warns of potential disruptions to transport, including rail, road and air, with power outages also likely.

K-pop group SEVENTEEN announce release date for their 12th mini-album. WatchK-pop sensation SEVENTEEN is ready to make a grand return with their 12th mini-album. The announcement has stirred excitement among fans, promising a fresh chapter in their musical journey.

Singer Cardi B welcomes third child with ex-husband OffsetSinger and rapper Cardi B welcomed her third child on September 7 with her ex-husband Offset. She shared a series of happy family pictures to announce the exciting news.

Ajith Kumar buys Porsche GT3 RS worth Rs 4 crore, wife Shalini shares picActor Ajith Kumar bought a new Porsche GT3 RS worth Rs 4 crore. His wife and former actor Shalini shared a picture of the actor with the car.

The Penguin: Critics call Colin Farrell series a qualified triumphThe first reviews of The Batman spin-off, The Penguin, are here. Critics have praised both the story and the acting, calling it a triumph.

sports.headline: Past results won't matter against Pakistan: India captain Harmanpreet SinghHarmanpreet Singh has claimed that past results won't matter when they play against Pakistan in the Asian Champions Trophy 2024. India and Pakistan will meet on September 14, Saturday.

The 22-time Grand Slam champion has seemingly adopted a wait-and-watch approach in a season where he has struggled to get back to his best.

R Ashwin's wife wishes good luck to ace-spinner for home Test in Chennai vs BANPrithi Narayanan expressed her excitement about Chennai hosting the 1st Test match between India and Bangladesh. She shared Ravichandran Ashwin's picture, who was in his training gear.

Rodri amped up to realise Ballon d'Or dream: Streets want me to winRodri, Manchester City's star midfielder, already feels like a Ballon d'Or winner, with fans on the streets hailing him as a deserving recipient after his outstanding 2023-2024 season for club and country.

Steeplechaser Avinash Sable looks to end season on a high in BrusselsDiamond League Final 2024: Steeplechaser Avinash Sable, India's national record holder, will look to end his season on a high. He will compete in a 12-man field in men's 3000m steeplechase in the season-ending summit event in Brussels on Friday, September 13.

Tennis players avoid the traffic with tournament-provided helicopter ridesGuadalajara's WTA 500 tournament has introduced a unique perk for players: helicopter rides to avoid traffic and reach the venue quickly. This experience has become a player's favourite, offering both convenience and a memorable view of the city from above.

Want to make the World Test Championship Final again: Gary SteadNew Zealand head coach Gary Stead is focused on leading the Blackcaps to consecutive World Test Championship Finals, emphasizing the importance of every match as they aim to replicate their 2019-2021 WTC triumph.

England vs Australia 2nd T20I Live Streaming: When and where to watch liveENG vs AUS 2nd T20I: England will host Australia at London Sophia Gardens Cricket Ground in Cardiff. Australia lead the 3-match T20I series 1-0.

Shams Mulani's wait for maiden first-class ton continues, scores 89 for India ADuleep Trophy 2024: Shams Mulani will have to wait for his maiden first-class hundred. The India A all-rounder departed after scoring 89 runs against India D in Anantapur.

'Very disappointed': Afghanistan coach reflects on abandoned Greater Noida TestAfghanistan vs New Zealand, one-off Test: Afghanistan coach Jonathan Trott said the possibility of a white-ball game as a replacement for the Test was discussed, but persistent rain in Greater Noida made it impossible for any action.

Glenn Maxwell excited to see Kohli-Smith go head-to-head in Border Gavaskar seriesGlenn Maxwell expressed his excitement to see Virat Kohli and Glenn Maxwell go head-to-head against each other in the upcoming Border Gavaskar series. He also called them as two of the finest players of the generation.

Wearing sunglasses while batting, Shreyas Iyer falls for a duck in Duleep TrophyDuleep Trophy 2024: India D captain Shreyas Iyer, who wore sunglasses while batting, failed to trouble the scorers. His troubles against the short deliveries continued as left-arm pacer Khaleel Ahmed dismissed him on Friday morning in Anantapur.

In pics: Gambhir leads Indian team's huddle in Chennai for Bangladesh Test seriesGautam Gambhir led the Indian team's huddle as the Test squad reached Chennai ahead of the 1st match vs Bangladesh. The opening Test will be played on September 19.

Mbappe and PSG set for likely court battle after wage disputeKylian Mbappé and PSG are likely headed for a legal battle after the club refused to pay his unpaid wages, following his free transfer to Real Madrid, marking a bitter end to their seven-year relationship.

Usman Khawaja picks Travis Head as Australia's opener for Border Gavaskar seriesUsman Khawaja picked Travis Head as his opening partner for the Border Gavaskar series between India and Australia. Khawaja felt that Steve Smith should bat at No. 4.

'Played like performers not participants': PM Modi praises Paralympics starsPrime Minister Narendra Modi praised India's Paralympians for their historic 29-medal haul at the Paris Paralympics, commending their role in shifting the nation's mindset from just participating to competing with a winning attitude on the global stage.

Watch: Virat Kohli arrives in Chennai for India vs Bangladesh Test seriesVirat Kohli has arrived in Chennai for the 1st Test between India and Bangladesh. He landed at Chennai airport, directly from London, as the star batter would regroup with the Indian team.

Former Celta Vigo captain Hugo Mallo found guilty of sexual assaultFormer Celta Vigo captain Hugo Mallo was found guilty of sexually assaulting Espanyol's mascot back in 2019. The player plans to appeal the Barcelona court's ruling, which has drawn significant attention due to his high-profile status.

Carlos Alcaraz set to face Ben Shelton in Madison Square exhibition clashCarlos Alcaraz headlines the star-studded Garden Cup at Madison Square Garden in December, facing Ben Shelton. With top players like Jessica Pegula and Emma Navarro, the event marks tennis' return to the iconic venue since 2018.

Rain in Greater Noida leads to first abandoned Test match in 26 yearsThe one-off Test match between Afghanistan and New Zealand became only the 8th Test match in cricketing history to be abandoned without any ball being bowled. Persistent rain in Greater Noida played spoilsport on all five days of the Test match.

Shane Warne's daughter wishes him a 'happy heavenly birthday', shares on InstaShane Warne's daughter Brook shared a heartfelt birthday wish for her father, who would have turned 55 on September 13. Warne suffered a heart attack and passed away 2 years ago.

Asian Champions Trophy 2024, India vs Pakistan: H2H, all you need to knowIndia and Pakistan will renew their rivalry on the hockey field as they face off in the Asian Champions Trophy 2024 on September 14, Saturday.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.

WC influential ten: Writers community honors digital social change makersWriters Community Freelancers Releases 'WC Influential Ten' List Recognizing Social Impact through Virtual Space and Social Media
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
